page.title: 01INDUSTRY IN A VILLAGE
page.content: To the east of the village of Chedburgh pop. 490 along the A143 is a small industrial estate, including among others, a chemical plant Chafers Ltd. Chafers assure us there is no hazard but their lorries are only allowed to travel through the village empty. A warning siren has been installed, sounding similiar to the 'all clear' in the last war. The siren is tested every 1st Thursday in the month at 5.00 pm for approx. 2 mins. If the siren is sounded at any other time the you are: 1. Go to your own home 2. Close all windows and doors 3. Stay in your home until the Police or the specially trained Emergency Officer says it is safe to leave The Board Room of Chafer Ltd. is in what was the Officers Mess of the Lancaster Bomber Base in the war. A bomber is included in our village sign.
